instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message:
green light and orange present, no power on from battery and charger

ppbus_g3h 16.60v

pp3v42_g3h 3.42v

smc_reset_l 3,42v 

smc_on_off 3,42v

smc_bc_acok 3.31v

good charger and battery know,

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message: 16.6V on PPBUS is a problem. Shorted Q7030 I bet. Replace U7000, Q7030/35 and check resistance between pins 17/18, 27/28.

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message: Sorry PPBUS is 12.60V already check resistance between pins 17/18, 27/28

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message: Known good REAL 85W charger? PP3V3_S5 present?

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message: Real good know 85W charger, PP3V3_S5 pulsing

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message: Have you gone through the rails checking for shorts ?

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message: find short to gnd P5VS3_VSW remove L7220 and inject voltage ?

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message: Define "short". This line will measure low just after removing power. Do a resistance measurement and make sure the board is fully discharged.

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message:
fully discharged i've 000.3 ohms on L7220
any idea for PP5V_S3 pulses ? can come of many thing :/

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message: Inject voltage, but there are sooooo many components on this rail :(

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message:
current draw 2.88A pin 1 with 5V pin 2 0.01A

resistance to gnd pin 1 0 ohm pin 2 15kohms

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message: Something must be getting warm at 3A and 5V. You are putting 15W into the board! Use the good old lips and go over the board.

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message: Sincerely nothing heat :/ it's my first board nothing heat, with 15W yet I should find easily :/

threads.title: 820-2915 no power
threads.message: I cannot help you any further, that 15W must be going somewhere. Use thicker wires to the board and measure if the 5V is actually getting to the board and not already dropping somewhere in the PSU and wiring.
